info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 05 at 12:23AM CDT until May 05 at 12:45AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 AM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN SMITH...WESTERN RUSK...NORTHWESTERN NACOGDOCHES AND CHEROKEE COUNTIES... At 1222 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Arp to near Turnertown to near New Salem to 7 miles west of Alto, moving east at 45 mph. A 51 mph wind gust was measured at the Cherokee County Airport south of Jacksonville at 1215 AM with these storms. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Jacksonville, Henderson, Whitehouse, Rusk, Overton, Troup, Alto, New London, Arp, Morrill, Ponta, New Salem, Joinerville, Sacul, Turnertown, Minden, Maydelle, New Summerfield, Cushing and Gallatin. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
